author: J J
title: @template and multiple different types
question:
So far, we’ve learned that the @template expression describes the parameters of a function: ie. (@signature String -> Boolean) corresponds with (@template String) and so on and so forth.
But we’ve also had cases (problem 4, HtDF lecture) where the signature has two parameters (@signature Image Image -> Boolean). In this case, we still used just (@template Image), and (@template Image Image) was wrong. This seemed fine at the moment because both parameters were Images.
How will @template work with two parameters of different types? For example, if our signature is something like (@signature Image String -> Image)?
instructor_answer:
What we said last week was:
for now, you put the type of the first argument in the @template tag.
This will evolve as we go, but for now just work with this rule. We aren't ready to say more yet
Note in the case above that if you follow the rules we gave you for two functions, one that consumes Number and String in that order, and one that consumes String and Number in that order, you will end up with equivalent templates.
